name: Pastrami Chicken Wings
author: Chef John
summary: I've taken a spice rub traditionally used on a beef brisket to make pastrami, and applied it to America's favorite appetizer, chicken wings. This resulted in a pretty nice chicken wing recipe, which tasted nothing like pastrami.
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds chicken wings, separated at joints, tips discarded
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicon mat
Combine the chicken wings, vegetable oil, white pepper, black pepper, coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt in a large mixing bowl; toss with a spatula to coat evenly
Sprinkle with flour; toss again to coat evenly
Bake in the preheated oven until browned on top, about 25 minutes
Turn the wings and return to oven to bake until crisp, no longer pink in the center, and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes more
Remove immediately to a serving dish
